logicalTable.name: F6 Logical Calculations Examples
logicalTable.description:
This logical table contains metrics that always return value at a particular level within a dimension. Eg:- Revenue at Month level, Billed Qtry at Year level, Booked Amt for all Products etc.
All metrics in this table are logical calculations based on physically mapped metrics from F0 Rev Base Measures and F1 Inv Base Measures.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.10- Variable Costs
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.11- Fixed Costs

logicalColumns.name: 75  ======== Allocations Rules ========
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Header object, dummy not to be used in any queries

logicalColumns.name: 75  Yago Rev Allocation Factor
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue Forecast data. Sources from Dollars column in Forecast table. Grain of forecast is Market, Month  

- This aggregation will fragment physical data to a lower granularity then it is in the database, using the pattern of last year spread. Example : Forecast data is available by month in db, this metric will take the 'by month' information, and break it down at day level using the same spread as how last year's actual daily values were spread over the same month. This aggregation will apply similar break down on the following dimensions : Time, Customer, Market. I.e., forecast data available only by month by market level is fragmented further down to be "by customer, by product, by day" according to how that pattern was the previous year.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F5 Time Series and Level Based Examples.129  Year Ago Rev  (Fix Time Lvl)
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F6 Logical Calculations Examples.119  Rev  (Yago Sum for Non Target Dims)

logicalColumns.name: 76  Qago Rev Allocation Factor
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue Forecast data. Sources from Dollars column in Forecast table. Grain of forecast is Market, Month  

- This aggregation will fragment physical data to a lower granularity then it is in the database, using the pattern of last quarter spread. Example : Forecast data is available by month in db, this metric will take the 'by month' information, and break it down at day level using the same spread as how last quarter's actual daily values were spread over the same month. This aggregation will apply similar break down rule on the following dimensions : Time, Customer, Market. I.e., forecast data available only by month by market level is fragmented further down to be "by customer, by product, by day" according to how that pattern was the previous quarter.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F5 Time Series and Level Based Examples.128  Qtr Ago Rev  (Fix Time Lvl)
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F6 Logical Calculations Examples.118  Rev  (Qago Sum for Non Target Dims)

logicalColumns.name: 77  Allocated Target  (Yago Period Rule)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue Forecast data. Sources from Dollars column in Forecast table. Grain of forecast is Market, Month  

- This aggregation will fragment physical data to a lower granularity then it is in the database, using the pattern of last year spread. Example : Forecast data is available by month in db, this metric will take the 'by month' information, and break it down at day level using the same spread as how last year's actual daily values were spread over the same month. This aggregation will apply similar break down on the following dimensions : Time, Customer, Market. I.e., forecast data available only by month by market level is fragmented further down to be "by customer, by product, by day" according to how that pattern was the previous year.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F2 Fragmented Measures Targets.5d  Target Rev  (Sum All Non Target Dims)
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F6 Logical Calculations Examples.75  Yago Rev Allocation Factor

logicalColumns.name: 78  Allocated Target  (Qago Period Rule)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue Forecast data. Sources from Dollars column in Forecast table. Grain of forecast is Market, Month  

- This aggregation will fragment physical data to a lower granularity then it is in the database, using the pattern of last year spread. Example : Forecast data is available by month in db, this metric will take the 'by month' information, and break it down at day level using the same spread as how last year's actual daily values were spread over the same month. This aggregation will apply similar break down on the following dimensions : Time, Customer, Market. I.e., forecast data available only by month by market level is fragmented further down to be "by customer, by product, by day" according to how that pattern was the previous year.

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F2 Fragmented Measures Targets.5d  Target Rev  (Sum All Non Target Dims)
logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F6 Logical Calculations Examples.76  Qago Rev Allocation Factor

logicalColumns.name: 119  Rev  (Yago Sum for Non Target Dims)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- 12 months prior to the current month, the value of the metric for the full month and at the Total level of Customer, Product and Employee

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue
logicalLevel:01 - Sample App.H0 Time.Year

logicalColumns.name: 118  Rev  (Qago Sum for Non Target Dims)
logicalColumns.description:
Help :
Revenue data. Sources from Dollars physical column in FactsRev table joining to time using Billed time.  

- 13 months prior to the current month, the value of the metric for the full month and at the Total level of Customer, Product and Employee

expressionObjects: logicalColumn:01 - Sample App.F0 Sales Base Measures.1- Revenue
logicalLevel:01 - Sample App.H0 Time.Month
